intro: Reseda pseudophyteuma, commonly known as the false sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Reseda pseudophyteuma is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
